However , succesfull even sufficient β-cell function present . We aim evaluate extent β-cell function determine fasting level C-peptide meal stimulus .
DOC.brief_title: β-cell Function Type 1 Diabetes May Not Be As Low As Presumed
DOC.detailed_description: Background aim : Enhancing endogenous insulin production type 1 diabetic patient ( T1DP ) improve glycemic control decrease complication rate mortality . However , succesfull even sufficient β-cell function present . We aim evaluate extent β-cell function determine fasting level C-peptide meal stimulus . Materials Methods : One hundred thiryfive T1DP plan enrolı study . Ethics comittee hospital approve study protocol , accordance Helsinki Declaration . Fasting C-peptide level participant stimulate ( 90 th minute post mixed meal ) C-peptide level 54 measure use electrochemiluminescence assay . Two categorization do use fasting ( first categorization ) 90th minute post mixed meal test ( second categorization ) C-peptide level . For first categorization ; group classify follow : patient undetectable ≤0.1 ng/mL ( group 1 ) ; minimal 0.1-0.8 ng/ml ( group 2 ) ; sustain ≥0.8 ng/mL ( group 3 ) C-peptide level . For second categorization , group follow : patient undetectable ≤0.1 ng/mL ( group 1 ) ; minimal 0.1-0.8 ng/ml ( group 2 ) ; sustain ≥0.8 ng/mL ( group 3 ) C-peptide level increase 90th minute meal ≥150 % fast C-peptide level .
DOC.criteria: Type 1 diabetic patient accept mixed meal tolarance test Patients type 2 diabetes , patient MODY
